ES2015

Few examples of new techniques / tools from es2015. Use of let and const instead of var, demo of the .map function and new arrow (aka fat arrow) functions.

Things to note:

  • ???

var

Use of a var in this demo which the user can then change the value of using the form. If you check the console you will see an error for the log i have put in as i am looking for the value of the var before it is defined. Notice the error is undefined this is because var is affected by hoisting. 

// Set a default name and add to DOM element
var demoOneVar = "Ben Kenny";
document.getElementById("demoOneVarResult").innerHTML = "<strong>" +demoOneVar+".</strong>";

// On button click take value entered by user and update the original var.
// Update DOM element with new name
document.getElementById('fullNameSubmit').onclick = function(event) {
    event.preventDefault();
    const value = document.getElementById('fullName').value;
    demoOneVar = value;
    document.getElementById("demoOneVarResult").innerHTML = "<strong>" +demoOneVar+".</strong>";
};

Update var

Change the value associated with the var here.

demoOneVar currently =

let

Use of a let in this demo which the user can then change the value of using the form. If you check the console you will see an error for the log i have put in as i am looking for the value of the let before it is defined. Notice the error is a ReferenceError this is because let is unaffected by hoisting.

The console error actually stops the rest of the script working so i have commented out in code, but above statement still stands.

// Set a default name and add to DOM element
let demoTwoVar = "Georgi Mann";
document.getElementById("demoTwoVarResult").innerHTML = "<strong>" +demoTwoVar+".</strong>";

// On button click take value entered by user and update the original var.
// Update DOM element with new name
document.getElementById('demoTwofullNameSubmit').onclick = function(event) {
    event.preventDefault();
    const value = document.getElementById('demoTwofullName').value;
    demoTwoVar = value;
    document.getElementById("demoTwoVarResult").innerHTML = "<strong>" +demoTwoVar+".</strong>";
};

Update let

Change the value associated with the let here.

demoTwoVar currently =

const

Use of a const in this demo which the user cannot change as a const can only assign once a value in a variable. If you check the console you will see an error for the log i have put in as i am looking for the value of the const before it is defined. Notice the error is a ReferenceError this is because const is unaffected by hoisting.

The console error actually stops the rest of the script working so i have commented out in code, but above statement still stands.

// Set a default name and add to DOM element
const demoThreeVar = "Dave Jones";
document.getElementById("demoThreeVarResult").innerHTML = "<strong>" +demoThreeVar+".</strong>";

// On button click take value entered by user and update the original var.
// Update DOM element with new name
document.getElementById('demoThreefullNameSubmit').onclick = function(event) {
    event.preventDefault();
    const value = document.getElementById('demoThreefullName').value;
    demoThreeVar = value;
    document.getElementById("demoThreeVarResult").innerHTML = "<strong>" +demoThreeVar+".</strong>";
};

Update const

Change the value associated with the const here.

This will not work

demoThreeVar currently =
